question: i am a revert to Islam. could you please tell me if it is allowed for me to attend funerals in church of my Christian relatives. Thank you.
answer:
QUESTION
asalamalaikum.  i am a revert to Islam. could you please tell me if it is allowed for me to attend funerals in church of my Christian relatives.  Thank you.

ANSWER


Share:

Respected Brother/sister in Islam

Assalamu alaukum wa rahmatullahi wa barakatuh

We do understand the dilemma reverts experience when their non muslim relatives pass away.One one hand, they have a natural feeling for their relatives but on the other hand,they are non muslims and do not want to violate the principles of Islam in associating with non muslim relatives.

Islam has emphasized on family ties.One should maintain ties with all family members to the best of ones ability even though the family members may be non muslims.Islam strengthens ties and does not brake ties.Islam means peace and a muslim should exemplify peace and harmony with whoever he comes in contact with.To maintain family ties with non muslim relatives is a means of Da’wah to them.They will observe the beauty of Islam and be attracted to it.It does not help to be distant from non muslim relatives.Yes, provided one is strong in his Deen and does not compromise.

If a non muslim relative passes away, one should express his grief and condolences to the bereaved family.He should show his remorse and feel the pain of death of his relative.However, now that he is a muslim, he should also take into cognizance his Islamic values and principles.He should maintain ties and express his condolences without breaking the laws of Shariah.The funeral procedures of non muslims are conducted according to their religion.For example, in Christianity, the horn is blown.Various passages of the Bible are read and devotion to Jesus is expressed.All this is completely contrary to Islam.It is therefore not permissible for a muslim relative to take part in the actual funeral process of ones non muslim relative.

And Allah Ta’ala knows best.

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
